isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 5.2 PRO-LINK 9000 ELECTRONIC SERVICE TOOL OPERATION - SERVICE TOOL FUNCTIONS - RS-232 SERIAL PORT

svcprocinfo.para:
This selection allows the technician to configure the Pro-Link RS-232 serial port for either printer or terminal (personal computer) output. The screen in Figure 5.38
appears when this item is selected.

figure.caption: Figure 5.38 - Pro-link RS-232 Serial Port Screen

svcprocinfo.para: This selection is used to print out diagnostic information.

The Pro-Link is set up to print to the Pro-Link Printer and no Port Setup is necessary for that printer. In order to print to a different printer, follow the instructions under Port Setup, in the Electronic Service Tool manual.

The screen in Figure 5.39
will be displayed if the "PRINTER OUTPUT" function is selected.
There are five types of data which can be printed out:
Press the "↓" key to select other options. Press "ENTER"and the selection will be printed.

svcsubproc.title: Snapshot
svcsubproc.para:
Selecting the Snapshot option will display the screen in Figure 5.40
.

svcsubproc.title: Complete
svcsubproc.para:
Choosing "COMPLETE" produces a screen as shown in Figure 5.41
.
TRIG = Frame number that contains the
FRAME = Total number of frames in Snapshot
START = The first frame desired to print

Selecting "COMPLETE" will print all lines of the data list. Enter the first frame desired to print at "START" and press "ENTER". Now line four will display END = # # #. Enter the last frame desired to print and press "ENTER". The tool will now print the complete data list for each of the frames that are selected.

svcsubproc.title: Custom
svcsubproc.para:
Selecting Custom produces the screen in Figure 5.42
.

Press the "ENTER" key and the screen in Figure 5.43
appears.

Use the "↑↓" keys to scroll the list on line four. Choose the item desired for column 1 of the custom list, press the "ENTER" key. Line three, "COLUMN #", advances to 2. Repeat this procedure for all six columns of data to be printed. Press the "FUNC" key when finished. The Select Frames screen appears. Select the desired frames to print and the Custom printout will begin.
